definition: plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: Chapter 8 of the book will explain how all six levels are integrated into the process of reading a chart.
sentences.chinese: 本书第八章将融合前六章内容向读者解释如何读星盘。

sentences.english: This chart energy will lead you towards new directions & adventures.
sentences.chinese: 星盘带领你走向新的方向，冒险新的事物。

sentences.english: It looks exactly like the spinning astrolabe from the opening credits.
sentences.chinese: 这看起来分明就像片头里旋转的星盘。

sentences.english: Taurus rules your ninth house, which is naturally one of the luckiest areas of your sign's chart.
sentences.chinese: 金牛座掌管你的第九宫，即星盘上最自然而然的幸运。

sentences.english: Astrolabes ultimately led to the development of astronomical clocks.
sentences.chinese: 通用星盘的出现最终导致了天文钟的发展。

sentences.english: Often we do charts that are not associated with normal soul or body concepts;
sentences.chinese: 我们往往不能视星盘为一个普通的灵魂或身体概念。

sentences.english: With the Sun in your sign, you're empowered, confident and  enthusiastic about life.
sentences.chinese: 太阳处于双子座星盘，你能力加强，自信，充满激情。

sentences.english: Other early instruments included the sextant and the astrolabe.
sentences.chinese: 另外的早期仪器还有六分仪和星盘。

sentences.english: A fortunate 11th house is a beneficial influence for any chart.
sentences.chinese: 一个幸运的11宫对于任何星盘都是有积极影响的。

sentences.english: Travel is written all over your chart, so you won't lack opportunity, for sure!
sentences.chinese: 你的星盘上写满了旅行，肯定会有机会出去旅行。

sentences.english: In my opinion, these horoscopes supply the missing piece to relationship readings.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，这些星盘提供了关系解读中缺失的部分。

sentences.english: Since we are inside this disk, the band appears to encircle the Earth.
sentences.chinese: 由于我们身处星盘之中，光带看起来环绕着地球。

definition: aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)
Zi Wei Dou Shu, a form of Chinese fortune-telling

the twelve equatorial constellations or signs of the zodiac in Western astronomy and astrology, namely: Aries 白羊[Bai2 yang2], Taurus 金牛[Jin4 niu2], Gemini 雙子|双子[Shuang1 zi3], Cancer 巨蟹[Ju4 xie4], Leo 獅子|狮子[Shi1 zi3], Virgo 室女[Shi4 nu:3], Libra 天秤[Tian1 cheng4], Scorpio 天蠍|天蝎[Tian1 xie1], Sagittarius 人馬|人马[Ren2 ma3], Capricorn 摩羯[Mo2 jie2], Aquarius 寶瓶|宝瓶[Bao3 ping2], Pisces 雙魚|双鱼[Shuang1 yu2]
seven heavenly bodies and four imaginary stars (in astrology and feng shui)
